lead_paragraph: FREEDMAN--Norman S. Norman S. Freedman of Larchmont, NY and Saxtons River, VT, died on February 22, 2016 at age 78. His advertising career highlights include the famed hidden case campaign for Canadian Club and the cult classic Schoolhouse Rock. Born May 26, 1937 and raised in Borough Park, Brooklyn, Norman was a graduate of NYU where he served on the Stern School Board of Overseers from 1999 to 2008. He is survived by his wife, Margot, his son and daughter-in-law Douglas and Lauri Freedman, his daughter and son-in- law Amy and Evan Lieberman and his five grandchildren Jack, Lucy, and Henry Freedman and Gideon and Jonah Lieberman. A memorial service will take place at Larchmont Temple at 11am on Friday, February 26th. The family will be receiving guests at their home following the service. The service can be viewed online by visiting: http://larchmonttemple.org/Praying/ Live--at--LT. For those wishing, the family requests a donation to any of the following organizations: The New Jewish Home: http://jewishhome.org/ Accelerate Brain Cancer Cure: http://abc2.org Cancer Research Institute: http://www.cancerresearch.org/memorial 1/3
